title: Post-deploy smoke verification for core navigation

requirements.summary: Add lightweight frontend smoke-check scaffolding and safer routing error handling to help verify the deployed app loads and core navigation works.
acceptanceCriteria: A new deployment run is triggered using the current repository state.
The deployment run completes successfully (no build/deploy error status).
After deployment, the app loads to the Home page without a fatal error.
Basic navigation works (Home -> Match History -> Home).

file_operations.description: Harden router initialization against runtime failures by adding a user-friendly route-level error screen (using existing UI primitives) so the deployed app does not present a blank/fatal crash on unexpected errors, and wire a dedicated SmokeCheckPage route for quick post-deploy verification.

Create a minimal SmokeCheckPage that renders an English-only checklist view with prominent navigation controls to Home and Match History, plus optional inline guidance for verifying the key flows after deployment (no new product features beyond verification scaffolding).

Add stable QA selectors (e.g., data-testid attributes) to the primary Home call-to-action that navigates to Match History, and ensure navigation uses router-safe primitives so Home -> Match History works reliably after deployment.
Add stable QA selectors (e.g., data-testid attributes) to the 'Back to Home' control and ensure it navigates reliably to '/', so Match History -> Home works reliably after deployment.
